meanings.definition: To take something away from someone
meanings.sent1: The bully was depriving the child of his lunch money.
meanings.sent2: The thief was caught depriving the store of its valuable items.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was depriving the birds of their seeds.
meanings.sent4: The storm was depriving the town of electricity.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick involved depriving the audience of their disbelief.

meanings.definition: To prevent someone from having something
meanings.sent1: The locked door was depriving him of entry into the room.
meanings.sent2: The strict rules were depriving the students of fun during recess.
meanings.sent3: The broken umbrella was depriving her of protection from the rain.
meanings.sent4: The closed bridge was depriving the travelers of reaching their destination.
meanings.sent5: The closed curtains were depriving the room of natural light.

meanings.sent1: The judge was depriving the criminal of his freedom.
meanings.sent2: The strict diet was depriving her of her favorite desserts.
meanings.sent3: The faulty alarm clock was depriving him of a good night's sleep.
meanings.sent4: The canceled flight was depriving the passengers of their vacation plans.
meanings.sent5: The strict teacher was depriving the students of their creativity.
